intro: Craterosiphon beniensis, commonly known as the Benin green alga, is a species of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its filamentous structure, with thallus composed of interwoven filaments that form a dense, turgescent mat. The plant typically grows in freshwater environments, such as ponds and slow-moving streams, where it attaches to submerged surfaces. Its morphology includes a variety of cell shapes and sizes, with some cells specialized for reproduction. Craterosiphon beniensis plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various aquatic organisms.
